header: This is a 15-second music video edit across 22 segments. I had to force an aggressive pace because the library was missing the medium-energy shots needed for a smoother build.

advisor.hero: Your library is starving for payoff shots and fire motifs, which turned this edit into a frantic sprint just to keep the energy from flatlining.
advisor.body: Because I couldn't find any medium-energy clips or a 'fire' motif, I had to lean on high-speed cuts and aggressive pacing. The technical sync is tight, but the emotional arc is limited by the lack of actual payoff visuals in the footage provided.

friction_log: I felt confident setting up the intro, but the lack of fire motifs immediately limited my options.
The middle was a struggle; I had to force the pace because the library lacked the medium-energy clips to bridge the gaps.
I finished strong on technical sync, but the final sequence of flashes was a fallback because there were no real payoff shots to use.

post_mortem.worked: The rhythmic continuity is solid and the technical sync is tight despite the footage gaps.
post_mortem.didnt: The edit feels emotionally thin because the library is missing fire motifs and high-impact payoff shots.

next_steps: Shoot or source 'fire' motifs to fill the current thematic void.
Capture medium-energy transition shots to avoid forced aggressive pacing in future edits.
Get more high-impact payoff shots to give the sequence a proper climax.
technical: Applied a filmic commercial LUT to unify the disparate clips.
Maintained a relentless pacing strategy to mask the lack of semantic variety.
Ensured every cut is tightly synced to the reference track's transients.
